result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond J Lizardi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

Court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with MG.
